trans-unit.source: Secure a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Secure a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to secure an Azure web app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to secure an Azure web app.

trans-unit.source: Secure a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Secure a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: One of the challenges of developing a web app is how to provide a safe and secure service for your customers.
trans-unit.target: One of the challenges of developing a web app is how to provide a safe and secure service for your customers.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn about features of [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) that can secure your web app.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn about features of [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) that can secure your web app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] A full discussion of security considerations for web-based applications is beyond the scope of this document.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] A full discussion of security considerations for web-based applications is beyond the scope of this document.

trans-unit.source: As a starting point for further guidance on securing web applications, see the [Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP)]( https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Main_Page), specifically the [top 10 project.](https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Category:OWASP_Top_Ten_Project), which lists the current top 10 critical web application security flaws, as determined by OWASP members.
trans-unit.target: As a starting point for further guidance on securing web applications, see the [Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP)]( https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Main_Page), specifically the [top 10 project.](https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Category:OWASP_Top_Ten_Project), which lists the current top 10 critical web application security flaws, as determined by OWASP members.

trans-unit.source: Secure communications
trans-unit.target: Secure communications

trans-unit.source: If you use the ***.azurewebsites.net** domain name created for your web app, you can immediately use HTTPS, as an SSL certificate is provided for all ***.azurewebsites.net** domain names.
trans-unit.target: If you use the ***.azurewebsites.net** domain name created for your web app, you can immediately use HTTPS, as an SSL certificate is provided for all ***.azurewebsites.net** domain names.

trans-unit.source: If your site uses a [custom domain name](web-sites-custom-domain-name.md), you can upload an SSL certificate to [enable HTTPS](web-sites-configure-ssl-certificate.md) for the custom domain.
trans-unit.target: If your site uses a [custom domain name](web-sites-custom-domain-name.md), you can upload an SSL certificate to [enable HTTPS](web-sites-configure-ssl-certificate.md) for the custom domain.

trans-unit.source: Secure development
trans-unit.target: Secure development

trans-unit.source: Publishing profiles and publish settings
trans-unit.target: Publishing profiles and publish settings

trans-unit.source: When developing applications, performing management tasks, or automating tasks using utilities such as **Visual Studio**, **Web Matrix**, **Azure PowerShell** or the **Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)**, you can use either a *publish settings* file or a *publishing profile*.
trans-unit.target: When developing applications, performing management tasks, or automating tasks using utilities such as **Visual Studio**, **Web Matrix**, **Azure PowerShell** or the **Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)**, you can use either a *publish settings* file or a *publishing profile*.

trans-unit.source: Both authenticate you to Azure, and should be secured to prevent unauthorized access.
trans-unit.target: Both authenticate you to Azure, and should be secured to prevent unauthorized access.

trans-unit.source: A **publish settings** file contains
trans-unit.target: A **publish settings** file contains

trans-unit.source: Your Azure subscription ID
trans-unit.target: Your Azure subscription ID

trans-unit.source: A management certificate that allows you to perform management tasks for your subscription *without having to provide an account name or password*.
trans-unit.target: A management certificate that allows you to perform management tasks for your subscription *without having to provide an account name or password*.

trans-unit.source: A **publishing profile** file contains
trans-unit.target: A **publishing profile** file contains

trans-unit.source: Information for publishing to your web app
trans-unit.target: Information for publishing to your web app

trans-unit.source: If you use a utility that uses publish settings or publish profile, import the file containing the publish settings or profile into the utility and then **delete** the file.
trans-unit.target: If you use a utility that uses publish settings or publish profile, import the file containing the publish settings or profile into the utility and then **delete** the file.

trans-unit.source: If you must keep the file, to share with others working on the project for example, store it in a secure location such as an **encrypted** directory with restricted permissions.
trans-unit.target: If you must keep the file, to share with others working on the project for example, store it in a secure location such as an **encrypted** directory with restricted permissions.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you should make sure the imported credentials are secured.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you should make sure the imported credentials are secured.

trans-unit.source: For example, **Azure PowerShell** and the **Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)** both store imported information in your **home directory** (*~* on Linux or OS X systems and */users/yourusername* on Windows systems.) For extra security, you may wish to **encrypt** these locations using encryption tools available for your operating system.
trans-unit.target: For example, **Azure PowerShell** and the **Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)** both store imported information in your **home directory** (*~* on Linux or OS X systems and */users/yourusername* on Windows systems.) For extra security, you may wish to **encrypt** these locations using encryption tools available for your operating system.

trans-unit.source: Configuration settings, and connection strings
trans-unit.target: Configuration settings, and connection strings

trans-unit.source: It's common practice to store connection strings, authentication credentials, and other sensitive information in configuration files.
trans-unit.target: It's common practice to store connection strings, authentication credentials, and other sensitive information in configuration files.

trans-unit.source: Unfortunately, these files may be exposed on your website, or checked into a public repository, exposing this information.
trans-unit.target: Unfortunately, these files may be exposed on your website, or checked into a public repository, exposing this information.

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service allows you to store configuration information as part of the Web Apps runtime environment as **app settings** and **connection strings**.
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service allows you to store configuration information as part of the Web Apps runtime environment as **app settings** and **connection strings**.

trans-unit.source: The values are exposed to your application at runtime through *environment variables* for most programming languages.
trans-unit.target: The values are exposed to your application at runtime through *environment variables* for most programming languages.

trans-unit.source: For .NET applications, these values are injected into your .NET configuration at runtime.
trans-unit.target: For .NET applications, these values are injected into your .NET configuration at runtime.

trans-unit.source: **App settings** and **connection strings** are configurable using the [Azure preview portal](http://portal.azure.com) or utilities such as PowerShell or the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: **App settings** and **connection strings** are configurable using the [Azure preview portal](http://portal.azure.com) or utilities such as PowerShell or the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: For more information on app settings and connection strings, see [Configuring web apps](web-sites-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on app settings and connection strings, see [Configuring web apps](web-sites-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: FTPS
trans-unit.target: FTPS

trans-unit.source: Azure provides secure FTP access access to the file system for your web app through **FTPS**.
trans-unit.target: Azure provides secure FTP access access to the file system for your web app through **FTPS**.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to securely access the application code on the web app as well as diagnostics logs.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to securely access the application code on the web app as well as diagnostics logs.

trans-unit.source: The FTPS link for your web app can be found with the following steps:
trans-unit.target: The FTPS link for your web app can be found with the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Open the [Azure preview portal](http://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Open the [Azure preview portal](http://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: Select **Browse All**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Browse All**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Browse** blade, select **Web Apps**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Browse** blade, select **Web Apps**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Web Apps** blade, Select the desired web app.
trans-unit.target: From the **Web Apps** blade, Select the desired web app.

trans-unit.source: From the web app's blade, select **All settings**.
trans-unit.target: From the web app's blade, select **All settings**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Settings** blade, select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Settings** blade, select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: The FTP and FTPS links are provided on the **Settings** blade.
trans-unit.target: The FTP and FTPS links are provided on the **Settings** blade.

trans-unit.source: For more information on FTPS, see [File Transfer Protocol](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol).
trans-unit.target: For more information on FTPS, see [File Transfer Protocol](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For more information on the security of the Azure platform, information on reporting a **security incident or abuse**, or to inform Microsoft that you will be performing **penetration testing** of your site, see the security section of the [Microsoft Azure Trust Center](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/security/).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the security of the Azure platform, information on reporting a **security incident or abuse**, or to inform Microsoft that you will be performing **penetration testing** of your site, see the security section of the [Microsoft Azure Trust Center](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/security/).

trans-unit.source: For more information on **web.config** or **applicationhost.config** files in web apps, see [Configuration options unlocked in Azure App Service web apps](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/01/28/more-to-explore-configuration-options-unlocked-in-windows-azure-web-sites/).
trans-unit.target: For more information on **web.config** or **applicationhost.config** files in web apps, see [Configuration options unlocked in Azure App Service web apps](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/01/28/more-to-explore-configuration-options-unlocked-in-windows-azure-web-sites/).

trans-unit.source: For information on logging information for web apps, which may be useful in detecting attacks, see [Enable diagnostic logging](web-sites-enable-diagnostic-log.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on logging information for web apps, which may be useful in detecting attacks, see [Enable diagnostic logging](web-sites-enable-diagnostic-log.md).

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
